text:
This is how I’d recommend Software Engineer professional training to look like, and probably a good partitioning of study groups:
1. if no experience: take a good data structures class, like <https://sp23.datastructur.es/|CS61B>. It’s difficult so harder topics can be skimmed and revisited later. And do <https://leetcode.com/study-plan/leetcode-75|Level 1-2 of LeetCode’s 75> study plan. This is typically enough for an entry level SWE job (for FAANG-type, need 1st half of 2)
2. If 1-2 years work experience, take a good algorithms class like <https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-part1|Princeton Algos I> and <https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-part2|Algos II>, (+ do Level 3 of LeetCode’s plan) and learn scalable systems design (theory + examples) like with <https://www.educative.io/courses/grokking-modern-system-design-interview-for-engineers-managers?utm_campaign=system_design&utm_source=google&utm_medium=ppc&utm_content=search&utm_term=course&eid=5082902844932096&utm_term=system%20design%20interview&utm_campaign=%5BNew%5D+System+Design-Search-US+CAN&utm_source=adwords&utm_medium=ppc&hsa_acc=5451446008&hsa_cam=18164799962&hsa_grp=143542821307&hsa_ad=618618230577&hsa_src=g&hsa_tgt=kwd-297953488694&hsa_kw=system%20design%20interview&hsa_mt=b&hsa_net=adwords&hsa_ver=3&gclid=Cj0KCQjwqs6lBhCxARIsAG8YcDjyZ1aBN_gxVkXxoNxpHogaJ4OfSBM_G_rD05s5G5UwQ_vvtrmPn-QaAl_IEALw_wcB|Grokking>. Along with progressive work experience, this may be good enough for mid-level FAANG type jobs. 
3. Senior or architect levels requires a good amount of experience in working with and designing large scale systems, as well as leadership skills. Diving more into large scale systems like with <https://dataintensive.net/|DDIA>, reading engineering blogs, stories and evolution of architecture like with <https://www.youtube.com/@infoq|InfoQ>.

text: I am interested <@UDWBBD1HC>. I am in midtown but I am flexible to meet anywhere in the metro Atlanta area
